str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: It becomes, is fitting to, is right. Apparently a primary verb; to tower up, i.e. to be suitable or proper.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.

word: there must not be even a hint
parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From onoma; to name, i.e. Assign an appellation; by extension, to utter, mention, profess.
Fornication, whoredom; met: idolatry. From porneuo; harlotry; figuratively, idolatry.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Uncleanness, impurity. From akathartos; impurity, physically or morally.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
Covetousness, avarice, aggression, desire for advantage. From pleonektes; avarice, i.e. fraudulency, extortion.
